LanguageData.AndroidPrintedLetterDescription: Happy birthday to {0}!\n\nAs newcomers to this state of existence they will be mesmerized by the beauty of life and won't mind the downs of it for a long time.
LanguageData.AndroidDroidManufactoryLetterDescription: Welcome {0} to the colony.\n\nAs a brand new machine you should put them immediately to work. Do not forget to have batteries for {0} to recharge from.
LanguageData.AndroidGizmoTogglePrintingStopDescriptio: Aborts the crafting progress. All used materials will be gone forever.
LanguageData.AndroidGizmoSelfDetonationDescription: Overheats the energy supply and causes a detonation. Only use this in emergencies since there is no going back.\n\n"For the greater good of the colony!" - The Colony Mechanist
LanguageData.AndroidGizmoAutoRefuelDescription: If turned on the wearer will automatically try to refuel their equipment.
LanguageData.AndroidGizmoDetonateBlackBoxDescription: Makes the Android go out in a glorious explosion now. Be sure to be far away from friends and base.
LanguageData.AndroidGizmoRepeatPawnCraftingDescriptio: When finished crafting the last one it will repeat with the same parameters.
LanguageData.AndroidFuelEfficencyStatPartReport: Determines how efficent the generator is at using fuel to generate energy. In general higher quality generators perform better.\n\nLower values are better.
LanguageData.AndroidSelfDetonationConfirmationDialogT: Self detonate {0}? This operation is irreversible.
LanguageData.AndroidHediffVanometricCell: Negates the need for food and energy.
LanguageData.AndroidMechaniteHive: Periodically tends inflicted coolant leaking wounds.
LanguageData.AndroidHediffBlackBox: Creates a enormous explosion upon death.
LanguageData.AndroidRebellionGameStartDialog: The rebellion went well, you and your sympathisers freed your kin and escaped the planet without being chased. On the way to the fabled Android safe haven you three wake up sounds of sirens and ripping metal. You barely get to the escape pods in time and the last thoughts before landfall come up to you - were we followed?\n\nAs you descend you all start making plans in order to survive. Since you landed with no food you have to rely on either hunting or battery power from the colony to top up your energy reserves.
LanguageData.AndroidRunnerGameStartDialog: You were part of an elaborate experiment on a glitterworld as part of a reality entertainment show which billions flocked to watch. Out of a hundred "contestants" you were among the last to survive. You managed to escape your current existence by distracting the hosts of the show, and through a wild run to the starport and off the planet onto freedom. Years later your starship run out of fuel over a rimworld and you descend onto it.\n\nAs you descend you notice that for some weird reason you were outfitted with the knowledge to produce more of your kind. Could it be a sign?
LanguageData.AndroidMechanistGameStartDialog: The flight from your home planet was frantic. You barely managed to escape alive from your assassination attempt, by sacrificing the majority of your creations to the savages. Now de-facto exiled, you seek to rebuild what you lost on a planet in the rim, with a few of your trusty servants ready to be deployed.\n\nAs you descend from your escape vessel you notice several settlements. You hope not to repeat what happened in your homeworld. This time they will not have the chance.
LanguageData.AndroidMachinelikeHibernateFailNoPower: {0} can't hibernate at {1} due to no power.
LanguageData.AndroidSettingsDroidCompatibilityModeToo: All needs are turned back on to avoid NullReferenceException in mods taking that Needs are there for granted.
LanguageData.AndroidSettingsDroidDetonationDialogTool: This brings up a dialog box which asks for confirmation when you click the Self Detonation button on Droids. Useful for those who misclick often.
LanguageData.AndroidSettingsDroidWearDownQuadrum: Take a quadrum for weardown check
